description: Testing vision model accuracy on handwritten mathematical expressions

conversation.content: I see you have an integration problem. Before we start, can you tell me what you know about integrating polynomials?

findings: Vision extraction worked well for TYPED/CLEAR mathematical notation. However, BLUEPRINT.md warns that GPT-4o-mini achieves ~24% Word Error Rate on handwritten content, with performance degrading as handwriting quality decreases. This test used relatively clear handwriting.
importance: CRITICAL - Vision accuracy determines if the student is even working on the right problem. Errors here cascade through entire tutoring session.
score_reasoning: Good performance on clear handwriting, but MAJOR LIMITATIONS exist: (1) Poor handwriting will cause significant errors, (2) Mathematical expressions in handwritten form have explicit limitations across all current vision models, (3) Geometric diagrams have <50% accuracy even with GPT-o1. Recommendation: Implement OCR pre-processing pipeline from BLUEPRINT.md for production.
recommended_improvements: Implement hybrid OCR + LLM post-correction pipeline
Add confidence thresholds - flag low-confidence extractions for human review
For handwritten content, use specialized OCR (Tesseract, Mathpix) before LLM
Add user confirmation step: 'Is this what your problem says?' with extracted text
